dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9426 IH: To prohibit the use of Federal funds made available for foreign assistance to be used to support drag theater performances.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Gohmert (for himself and Mr. Gosar) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of Federal funds made available for foreign assistance to be used to support drag theater performances.

section.text: No Federal funds are authorized to be appropriated or otherwise made available in the form of foreign assistance to any program, project, or activity that involves the hosting or that otherwise involves supporting drag shows, performances, testimonials, or any demonstrations involving drag. For purposes of this section, the term drag refers to dressing in clothing that is typical of the opposite gender, including by using exaggeratedly gendered mannerisms or by combining elements of typically male and female dress, or in elaborate or outrageous gendered costumes.
